`,(0,e.jsxs)(r.p,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(r.a,{href:"https://www.gl-inet.com/products/gl-be3600/",children:"GLiNet Slate 7"}),` is a compact WiFi 7 travel router with dual 2.5GbE ports, USB 3.0, and USB-C PD input.
It features a built-in touchscreen for quick access to VPN, TOR, WiFi settings, and device stats.
Powered by a 1.1GHz quad-core Qualcomm CPU, it includes 1GB RAM, 512MB flash, and OpenWRT preinstalled.
With speeds up to 1.3Gbps over WiFi and power use around 5W, it\u2019s ideal for travel networking.
At $150, it delivers strong value with NAS support, advanced features, and worldwide adapters included.`]}),`

`,(0,e.jsxs)(r.p,{children:["The ",(0,e.jsx)(r.a,{href:"https://jetkvm.com/",children:"JetKVM"})," is a compact, open-source KVM-over-IP device that allows full remote control of a computer\u2014even when it's powered off, locked, or unresponsive. It features HDMI, USB, and Ethernet connectivity, supporting functions like Wake-on-LAN, virtual USB mounting, and remote OS installation. Housed in a sturdy die-cast zinc alloy body, it\u2019s powered by a Rockchip CPU with hardware H.264/HEVC encoding for smooth, low-latency (~30\u2013100\u202Fms) streaming. Its web-based interface offers real-time performance stats and flexible access options, including local or cloud-based control. Priced from around $69, it\u2019s OTA-updatable and promises future open-source support, though it currently lacks built-in Wi-Fi and audio passthrough."]}),`

`,(0,e.jsxs)(r.p,{children:["The ",(0,e.jsx)(r.a,{href:"https://radxa.com/products/rock5/5t/",children:"Radxa Rock 5T"}),` is a powerful SBC powered by the RK3588 octa-core processor with 6 TOPS AI performance.
It supports up to 4 displays (including 8K60 HDMI and USB-C), dual 2.5GbE, HDMI input, Wi-Fi 6, and Bluetooth 5.2. With LPDDR5 RAM, dual PCIe NVMe slots, and M.2 for 4G modules, it\u2019s ideal for edge AI, media, or server use. Benchmark tests show strong multicore performance and fast NVMe and memory speeds.
It can run Home Assistant, NAS setups, and AI workloads, making it great for home labs and DIY projects.`]}),`

`,(0,e.jsxs)(r.p,{children:["The ",(0,e.jsx)(r.a,{href:"https://www.lattepanda.com/lattepanda-mu",children:"LattePanda\u202FMu"})," Lite Carrier Board, paired with the Intel\u202FN100-equipped Mu module, transforms the tiny 60\xD770\u202Fmm x86 board into a compact yet powerful top-tier mini PC reference design. It bridges essential I/O\u202F\u2014\u202FHDMI 2.0 output, USB\u202F3.2 Gen\u202F2, Gigabit Ethernet, PCIe\u202F3.0\u202Fx4 slot (with 12\u202FV input), and dual M.2 slots for NVMe storage or wireless modules. Powered via USB\u2011C (up to 15\u202FV) or a 12\u201320\u202FV DC jack, it supports passive or active cooling modes and runs Windows or Linux seamlessly. The Intel\u202FN100 chip delivers roughly twice the CPU and 10\u201330\xD7 GPU performance compared to Raspberry Pi\u202F5, all within a highly customizable, open-source carrier board platform. Perfect for DIY NAS, edge computing, mini servers, or custom embedded designs\u2014this board is an ideal x86 foundation for maker and home-lab projects."]}),`

frontMatter.title: I Built A DIY 10 Inch Server Rack
frontMatter.author: Amrut Prabhu
frontMatter.summary: DIY 10-inch rack using 2020 aluminium profiles—ideal for SBCs and home labs. Includes 3D print files and full build guide.

prev.title: GL.iNet Slate 7 (GL‑BE3600) Review: Your Ultimate Wi‑Fi 7 Travel Router
prev.author: Amrut Prabhu
prev.summary: Discover the GL.iNet Slate 7: a compact Wi‑Fi 7 travel router with dual 2.5GbE ports, touchscreen interface, and OpenWrt for secure, high-speed connectivity anywhere.
